title: So Is Cheating Gonna Be Addressed In TFT?
body:
So quite a fair few matches now I've seen players starting the game with 50+ Gold (you can see the 5 gold counters), and by the time they have their first player vs player round they already have a Tier 3 champion ready to go.

Anything gonna be done about this?
It's pretty early in the game mode's life for it to have such blatant cheating isn't it?

replies.body:
Hey Klavinmour,

As Seras has mentioned - we would love to get some more details about a player or game where you see this happening as we 100% will not allow this to happen.

Would love if you could provide as many details as possible, or keep an eye out in case it happens again and let me know?

Thanks for passing this on - I haven't seen any instances of this myself, but if it is happening it needs to be resolved ASAP so thanks for sharing.

Aye, was happening around 2am ish, and I did report it in game.

If I come across it again I'll be sure to get some screenshots.

I also experience it most of my games now! I can definitely say that it's very rampant. Although they have been much smarter now and would only cheat mostly in the champion pool. You can see the guy in the photo url have lvl3 Warwick so soon lol without using coins (i.e he hit 30 coin mark at lvl4). I also experience instances where 3 players having lvl3  kassadin at champion lvl of 5 like how is that possible if the champion pool is shared??

https://ibb.co/t4t7jJk (photo link)!!

I can't say I've seen (or at least I haven't noticed) any cheating myself. My recommendation would be to collect screenshots and submit to player support so they can be investigated. They won't be able to tell you anything regarding individual players of course, but if people are finding ways to cheat that's something they'll want to take care of ASAP, and the more information they have the better.
